reviews.review: This movie was very epic and many good things but it's have battles at Titan, Earth, and in space. I did like Thor's new the stormbreaker but no Hulk?! I have a theory a little bit, in Thor 3 when Thor say "HULK, FOR ONCE DON'T SMASH!!" that putting Hulk to keep that order from Thor from saying no! to Bruce.
Too much CGI, boring fight scenes, and bad jokes the movie.

Infinity War más que un epílogo, es un preludio al fin, la prueba máxima. Más allá de los sorprendentes efectos visuales o la majestuosa banda sonora de Alan Silvestri, aquí era hora de que todos se vieran las caras, uniendo fuerzas contra un enemigo en común, con un objetivo bien definido. Sin entrar en spoilers, el final es una oda a la tristeza, lamentable para unos pero más para aquellos que devotamente siguieron cada uno de los estrenos del MCU durante estos 10 años, que se encariñaron con los personajes, y quienes esperan la continuación de esta obra maestra de Marvel.

Infinty war was indeed a film that rised up to the long wait for 10 years . Infinty war could mainly seen as a movie which mobed around thanos building up his character to show wat he really is and wat he stands for infinty war struck gold with his character. All though they went ri8 with thanos they missed out on some main characters who lacked screen time . All in all infinty war had a very well structured plot which connects bits and pieces from the last 10 years hence creating a brilliant movie worth the name and very brave end to the movie as well

Hats off to the studio and cast for keeping the big reveals hidden all this time.  Trailers have a habit of giving too much away these days so I was skeptical.  The movie gave us a much needed villain with an excellent backstory and purpose beyond the generic "conquer and power"  the dialogue was potent with many emotions and was amazed the 2.5 hours was done when it was!  Excellent job with comic book references and use of material, juggling that many characters with individual story arcs that remained relevant even  if it was touched on just for a minute.  There will never be a movie franchise of this size and depth and if there is... it will always be compared to Marvel's

Amazing film that mamanges to weave multiple plots together very well. Also the screentime between characters is very well managed which is no small feat! Spoiler ahead: The only thing that could have made this a better movie is if they took out Star Lord punching Thanos. In an instant it seemed as if audiences forgot about the death of Gamorah and its emotional impact and instead thought about how Star Lords actions were selfish and shortsided. They could've easily had Thanos overpower Mantis and grab the gauntlet without Star Lord causing it, thus preserving the emotional impact of Gamorah's death on Peter and the aduience. Overall this was an amazing movie, but with that small addition I believe it would've been a perfect movie or as close to a perfect movie as you can get.
And that's how it's done.  Bad ass Movie!!
The action was okay, but we all know they come back in the next one. Same story.

This movie is highly overrated, the movie itself was good but definitely far from great like everyone is making it out to be.  Too many inconsistencies, seemed to jump around a lot and I left feeling quite unsatisfied.  I've enjoyed other Marvel movies a lot more than this one.  A bit of a let down considering it was 10 years in the making.
Fantastic addition to the MCU, loved this movie!
